reviewText: Don't take this movie too seriously and you'll just love it.  I've watched it every year for years.  I agree that it should be released on DVD; the prices for VHS are too high for a medium that tears up easily.  The storyline, about a singing star who escapes back to the area she came from to get away from showbiz, is cute but it's Dolly who makes the part.  The kids are adorable and I personally think that John Ritter has the best small part he ever played.  He just shines (and amuses you) as a judge.  I'd watch the show for that alone.  The witch is good, too, in a corny sort of way.  When she eats the pie and Dolly says, "Goodnight, Irene" I always laugh.  The songs are pretty good, too.  Give it a try!

reviewText: This is a very good video for the collection (however paying $40+ for the VHS is crazy).  Dolly Parton and Lee Majors are very good in this.  The story is a bit hoakey, but I don't mind it since it is a good story with no political correctness or other garbage such as the A Very Muppet Christmas was laden with.  Good and safe one for the family to watch!I wish it was released on DVD!
summary: A good Christmas video for the collection

reviewText: I had just turned 4 when this movie was first released and I remember watching it at least 50 times since, but sure it has been more! I absolutely loved this warm Christmas story and how it brought them all together like a real family! Was so great! I am very grateful to have had the privilege of sharing such a movie in my lifetime and plan to share this movie with my own son time and again! You just don't see movies like that made anymore. Such a shame! It shows how love and trust in any family, blood or not, takes some time and patience. But is well worth it all in the end! Also it's just all around a great family movie for any age. As I had said before, I loved it when I was a kid and am planning to share it with my own kids as time goes on. I recommend to anyone looking for something that the whole family can enjoy this holiday to watch A Smoky Mountian Christmas! It's sure to warm your heart and put a smile on your face! So glad I was able to finally find a copy of this to watch anywhere!!!  I was pleasantly surprised as I've tried to purchase it a few times elsewhere and it has been bad.  This one is much much better!

reviewText: I've always found myself liking both Dolly Parton's singing and her forays into acting in films like "Nine to Five", so when the opportunity came to see her in this seldom seen and very rare Christmas television movie I jumped at the chance and I'm so glad I did. Cast in a role totally suited to her as a country and western singer needing some time for the demands of work and personal troubles out over the Christmas period who escapes to a cabin in the mountains, Dolly exudes great warmth and makes this film ideal viewing over the festive season. Loosely based on the Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs story "Smoky Mountain Christmas", has a different look and feel compared to alot of other seasonal offerings and also has the great benefit of teaming Dolly with Lee Majors as a mountain man she encounters in her hideaway and the two surprisingly combine very well together on screen.
summary: Fine Family Christmas Movie Starring A Perfectly Cast Dolly Parton

reviewText: "A Smoky Mountain Christmas" originally aired in December, 1986 on ABC and quickly became the network's highest-rated telefilm in over two years. This prompted ABC to give Dolly her own weekly variety series the following season, but "Dolly" proved to be a ratings failure.In "A Smoky Mountain Christmas" Dolly plays a burned out singer who flees Hollywood and seeks shelter in a log cabin back in Tennessee. There she discovers several orphaned children who have run away from an abusive shelter.The movie is filled with holiday cheer, great new Dolly-composed songs, a witch, and several former 1970's TV stars in its cast like John Ritter and Lee Majors. The story was co-written by Dolly and is directed by the "Fonz" himself, Henry Winkler.The soundtrack has never been recorded for commercial use, but is filled with highlights including the title song and "Mountain Magic".Dolly would film another TV movie ten years later entitled "Unlikely Angel" that, unlike "A Smoky Mountain Christmas", is available on DVD. "A Smoky Mountain Christmas" was released commercially in the late eighties on VHS and on DVD in the early 2000's in Asia, but has never seen a rerelease on either DVD or Blue Ray in North America. It still is shown on various cable stations during the Holiday season though.
